conclusion: To determine the ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for particles A and B during their acceleration phases, analyze the slopes of the velocity-time (v-t) graph for each particle.
For particle A, the acceleration phase is from t = 0 to t = t_0.
For particle B, the acceleration phase is from t = 0 to t = 2t_0.
Calculate acceleration for particle A: Initial velocity u_A = 0, Final velocity v_A = 2v_0, Time interval Δt_A = t_0, Acceleration a_A = 2v_0/t_0.
Calculate acceleration for particle B: Initial velocity u_B = 0, Final velocity v_B = v_0, Time interval Δt_B = 2t_0, Acceleration a_B = v_0/(2t_0).
Determine the ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration: Ratio a_A/a_B = 4.
The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B during their acceleration phases is 4:1.
